page.title: 10FREEMANTLE PARK FARM
page.content: Freemantle Park Farm covers 142.4 hectares or 351.88 acres. The soil is chalk in some places, and in other places clay with flints over the chalk. The crop-growing land is 65.8 hectares, and grazing for cattle covers 56.5 hectares. There are 4.9 hectares of woodland, and buildings and roads cover 7.5 hectares. The crops grown are wheat, barley, grass and kale. There are70 Friesian cows, and a further 70 heifers or young stock. The average milk yield of the cows is 5900 litres. There are three men working on the farm. There are four tractors, and a contractor is employed for big jobs. Fertilizers are used for growing the wheat and barley, and also on the grass for the cows. Trees are replacing hedges as they make better windbreaks.
